title: Jewish Meditation: A Practical Guide
description:
Jewish Meditation: A Practical Guide By Aryeh Kaplan
1995 | 176 Pages | ISBN: 0805210377 | EPUB | 6 MB



Students of mediation are usually surprised to discover that a Jewish mediation tradition exists and that it was an authentic and integral part of mainstream Judaism until the eighteenth century.

Jewish Meditation is a step-by-step introduction to meditation and the Jewish practice of meditation in particular. This practical guide covers such topics as mantra meditation, contemplation, and visualization within a Jewish context. Through simple exercises and clear explanations of theory, Rabbi Kaplan gives us the tools to develop our spiritual potential through an authentically Jewish meditative practice.
